abstract: Researchers will begin first clinical trials of experimental treatments for Ebola in West African countries most affected by outbreak; such treatments have thus far mainly been available to small number of patients treated in the United States and Europe, but not to those in epidemic’s epicenter.
lead_paragraph: Until now, experimental treatments have mainly been available to the small number of patients treated in the United States and Europe, not Africans at the epidemic’s epicenter.

headline.main: Researchers to Test New Treatments in Countries Hit Hardest by Ebola
